[[«الرّیحَ»: باد. مفعول فعل محذوف (سَخَّرْنا) است (نگا: ص / 36). «غُدُوُّها»: بامدادان آن. مراد حرکت باد از صبح تا ظهر است. «رَوَاحُهَا»: شامگاهان آن. مراد حرکت باد به هنگام برگشت از ظهر تا شب است. باد چگونه دستگاه سلیمان - اعم از تخت یا فرش او - را به حرکت درمی‌آورده است، بر ما روشن نیست. «أَسَلْنَا»: جاری ساختیم. از ماده (سَیَلان). «عَیْنَ»: چشمه. مراد معدن است. «الْقِطْرِ»: مس مذاب (نگا: کهف / 96). «بِإِذْنِ رَبِّهِ»: به فرمان پروردگارش. مراد این است که خدا ایشان را مسخر و مطیع سلیمان کرد. «یَزِغْ»: منحرف و کج شود. یعنی بر سلیمان عصیان و طغیان کند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و برای سلیمان باد را [رام گردانیدیم‌]، که سیر بامدادیش یکماهه راه و سیر شامگاهیش یکماهه راه بود، و برای او چشمه مس [گداخته و جوشان‌] را روان ساختیم، و از جنیان گروهی در نزد او و به اذن پروردگارش کار می‌کردند، و هر کدام از آنان که از فرمان ما سرپیچید، به او از عذاب آتش [دوزخ‌] می‌چشانیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و برای سلیمان باد را مسخّر ساختیم که صبحگاهان مسیر یک ماه را می‌پیمود و عصرگاهان مسیر یک ماه را؛ و چشمه مس (مذاب) را برای او روان ساختیم؛ و گروهی از جنّ پیش روی او به اذن پروردگارش کار می‌کردند؛ و هر کدام از آنها که از فرمان ما سرپیچی می‌کرد، او را عذاب آتش سوزان می‌چشاندیم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و برای سلیمان باد را پیشینش یک ماه و پسینش یک ماه و روان (ذوب) ساختیم برایش چشمه مس را و از پریان آنان را که کار می‌کردند پیش رویش به دستور پروردگار او و آنکو کجروی می‌کرد از ایشان از فرمان ما می‌چشاندیمش از عذابی سوزان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و باد را براى سليمان [رام كرديم‌]، كه بامدادان يك ماهه راه مى‌پيمود و شبانگاه يك ماهه راه مى‌پيمود. و چشمه مس [گداخته‌] را براى او روان ساختيم، و از ديوان كسانى بودند كه به فرمان پروردگارش پيش او كار مى‌كردند و هر كه از فرمان ما كجروى مى‌كرد- فرمان سليمان نمى‌برد- او را از عذاب آتش افروخته مى‌چشانديم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و باد را برای سلیمان (راهوار کردیم). رفتن آن بامدادان، یک ماه و آمدنش عصر‌گاهان، یک ماه (راه) بود. و معدن مس را برای او روان گردانیدیم و برخی از جنّیان به فرمان پروردگارشان پیش او کار می‌کردند، در حالی‌که هر کس از آنان از دستورمان سر برتابد، از عذاب شعله‌ور سوزان به او می‌چشانیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: We (subjugated) the wind to Solomon. Its morning's journey took one month, and the evening's one month. We made a spring of molten brass to flow for him; and many jinns laboured for him by the will of his Lord. Anyone of them who turned from Our command was made to taste the torment of blazing fire.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And We gave the wind in Sulaiman’s control – its morning journey equal to a month’s course and the evening journey equal to a month’s course; and We sprung a stream of molten copper for him; and from the jinns, who worked before him by the command of his Lord; and those among them who turned away from Our command – We shall make them taste the punishment of the blazing fire.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And to Solomon the wind; its morning course was a month's journey, and its evening course was a month's journey. And We made the Fount of Molten Brass to flow for him. And of the jinn, some worked before him by the leave of his Lord; and such of them as swerved away from Our commandment, We would let them taste the chastisement of the Blaze;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And Unto Sulaiman We subjected the wind, whereof the morning journeying was a month and the evening journeying a month. And We made a fount of brass to flow for him. And of the Jinn were some who worked before him by the Will Of his Lord. And whosoever of them swerved from Our command, him We shall cause to taste the torment of the Blaze.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And to Solomon (We subjected) the wind, its morning (stride from sunrise till midnoon) was a month's (journey), and its afternoon (stride from the midday decline of the sun to sunset) was a month's (journey i.e. in one day he could travel two months' journey). And We caused a fount of (molten) brass to flow for him, and there were jinns that worked in front of him, by the Leave of his Lord, and whosoever of them turned aside from Our Command, We shall cause him to taste of the torment of the blazing Fire.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And for Solomon the wind—its outward journey was one month, and its return journey was one month. And We made a spring of tar flow for him. And there were sprites that worked under him, by the leave of his Lord. But whoever of them swerved from Our command, We make him taste of the punishment of the Inferno.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: And We subdued the wind to Solomon: its morning course was a month's journey and its evening course was a month's journey. We gave him a spring flowing with molten brass, and We subdued for him jinn who, by his Lord's permission, worked before him. Such of them as swerved from Our commandment, We let them taste the chastisement of the Blazing Fire.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And to Sulayman (We subjected) the wind, its morning was a month's (journey), and its afternoon was a month's (journey). And We caused a fount of Qitr to flow for him, and there were Jinn that worked in front of him, by the leave of his Lord. And whosoever of them turned aside from Our command, We shall cause him to taste of the torment of the blazing Fire.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And unto Solomon (We gave) the wind, whereof the morning course was a month's journey and the evening course a month's journey, and We caused the fount of copper to gush forth for him, and (We gave him) certain of the jinn who worked before him by permission of his Lord. And such of them as deviated from Our command, them We caused to taste the punishment of flaming Fire.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: And for Solomon [We subjected] the wind: its morning course was a month’s journey and its evening course was a month’s journey. We made a fount of [molten] copper flow for him, and [We placed at his service] some of the jinn who would work for him by the permission of his Lord, and if any of them swerved from Our command, We would make him taste the punishment of the Blaze.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: To Solomon the morning course of the wind was a month's journey, and its evening course was also a month's journey. We caused copper to be (as a) molten spring for him. And the jinn, some served him by the permission of his Lord. But as for those amongst them that swerved away from Our Command, We shall let them taste the punishment of the Blaze (the Fire).

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And to Solomon [We subjected] the wind - its morning [journey was that of] a month - and its afternoon [journey was that of] a month, and We made flow for him a spring of [liquid] copper. And among the jinn were those who worked for him by the permission of his Lord. And whoever deviated among them from Our command - We will make him taste of the punishment of the Blaze.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (We made subservient to) Solomon the wind that travelled a month's journey in the morning and a month's journey in the evening. We made a stream of brass flow for him and some of the jinn worked for him by his Lord's command. We would make whichever of them (jinn) who turned away from Our command to suffer a burning torment.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And (We made) the wind (subservient) to Sulaiman, which made a month's journey in the morning and a month's journey in the evening, and We made a fountain of molten copper to flow out for him, and of the jinn there were those who worked before him by the command of his Lord; and whoever turned aside from Our command from among them, We made him taste of the punishment of burning.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Walisulaymana alrreeha ghuduwwuha shahrun warawahuha shahrun waasalna lahu AAayna alqitri wamina aljinni man yaAAmalu bayna yadayhi biithni rabbihi waman yazigh minhum AAan amrina nuthiqhu min AAathabi alssaAAeeri

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We subjected the wind to Solomon; its morning course was a month and its evening course a month; and We caused a fount of molten copper to flow for him. And of the jinn there were some who worked under him, by the command of his Lord. If any one of them turned away from Our command, We would make him taste the punishment of the burning fire.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And to Solomon (We made) the Wind (obedient): Its early morning (stride) was a month's (journey), and its evening (stride) was a month's (journey); and We made a Font of molten brass to flow for him; and there were Jinns that worked in front of him, by the leave of his Lord, and if any of them turned aside from our command, We made him taste of the Penalty of the Blazing Fire.

verses.text: يَعْمَلُونَ‌ لَهُ‌ مَا يَشَاءُ مِنْ‌ مَحَارِيبَ‌ وَ تَمَاثِيلَ‌ وَ جِفَانٍ‌ کَالْجَوَابِ‌ وَ قُدُورٍ رَاسِيَاتٍ‌ اعْمَلُوا آلَ‌ دَاوُدَ شُکْراً وَ قَلِيلٌ‌ مِنْ‌ عِبَادِيَ‌ الشَّکُورُ

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [گروه جن] برای او هرچه می خواست، می ساختند از معبدها، و مجسمه ها، و ظروف بزرگی مانند حوض ها، و دیگ هایی ثابت. ای خاندان داود! به خاطر سپاس گزاری [به فرمان ها حق] عمل کنید؛ و از بندگانم اندکی سپاس گزارند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: براى وى هر چه مى‌خواست از بناهاى بلند و تنديسها و كاسه‌هايى چون حوض و ديگهاى محكم بر جاى، مى‌ساختند. اى خاندان داود، براى سپاسگزارى كارى كنيد و اندكى از بندگان من سپاسگزارند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: براى او هر چه مى‌خواست از معبدها و مجسمه‌ها و ظروف بزرگ مانند حوضچه‌ها و ديگ‌هاى ثابت مى‌ساختند. اى خاندان داود! شكرگزار باشيد، و تعداد كمى از بندگان من سپاسگزارند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [آن متخصصان‌] براى او هر چه مى‌خواست: از نمازخانه‌ها و مجسمه‌ها و ظروف بزرگ مانند حوضچه‌ها و ديگهاى چسبيده به زمين مى‌ساختند. اى خاندان داوود، شكرگزار باشيد. و از بندگان من اندكى سپاسگزارند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آن دیوان بر او هر چه می‌خواست از (کاخ و عمارات و) معابد عالی و نقوش و تمثالها و ظروف بزرگ مانند حوضها و دیگهای عظیم که بر زمین کار گذاشته بودی همه را می‌ساختند. (و گفتیم که) ای آل داود شما شکر و ستایش خدا به جای آرید و (هر چند) از بندگان من عدّه قلیلی شکر گزارند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آنان هر چه سلیمان می‌خواست برایش درست می‌کردند، از قبیل: پرستشگاههای عظیم، مجسّمه‌ها، ظرفهای بزرگ غذاخوریِ همانند حوضها، و دیگهای ثابت (که از بزرگی قابل جابه جائی نبود. به دودمان داود گفتیم:) ای دودمان داود! سپاسگزاری (این همه نعمت را) بکنید، و (بدانید که) اندکی از بندگانم سپاسگزارند (و خدای را به هنگام خوشی و نعمت یاد می‌آرند. پس کاری کنید که از زمره‌ی این گروه گزیده‌ی شکرگزار باشید). [[«مَحَارِیبَ»: جمع مِحراب، معبدها و پرستشگاهها. قصرها و کاخها. «تَمَاثِیلَ»: جمع تِمثال، مجسّمه‌ها و تندیسها. «جِفَانٍ»: جمع جَفْنَة، ظرفهای غذاخوری. «الْجَوابِ»: اصل آن (الْجَوابی) است و جمع جَابِیَة، حوضها. «جِفَانٍ کَالْجَوَابِ»: مراد ظرفهای غذاخوری همچون حوض است. از قبیل: مجمعه‌ها و سینیهای بزرگ. «قُدُورٍ»: جمع قِدْر، دیکها. «رَاسِیَاتٍ»: جمع راسِیَة، ثابت و پابرجا. مراد از (قُدُورٍ راسِیاتٍ) دیکهائی است که به سبب بزرگی و سنگینی آنها را از جا تکان ندهند و بالا و پائین نبرند. «الشَّکُورُ»: بسیار سپاسگزار.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: [آنان‌] برای او هر چه می‌خواست از محرابها و نقش و نگارها و کاسه‌های بزرگ حوض مانند، و دیگدانهای استوار [و غیر قابل نقل‌] می‌ساختند، [و گفتیم‌] ای خاندان داوود سپاس ورزید، و از بندگان من اندکی سپاسگزار هستند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آنها هر چه سلیمان می‌خواست برایش درست می‌کردند: معبدها، تمثالها، ظروف بزرگ غذا همانند حوضها، و دیگهای ثابت (که از بزرگی قابل حمل و نقل نبود؛ و به آنان گفتیم:) ای آل داوود! شکر (این همه نعمت را) بجا آورید؛ ولی عده کمی از بندگان من شکرگزارند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: می ساختند برایش هر چه می‌خواست از پرستشگاه‌ها و پیکرها و جامه‌هائی همانند آبگیرها (حوضها) و دیگهائی بر جای نشانده (در کوه یا سنگ) بکنید ای خاندان داود شکر را و کم است از بندگان من شکرگزار

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: براى او آنچه مى‌خواست از نمازگاه‌ها- يا كوشكها- و تنديسها و كاسه‌هايى به اندازه حوضها و ديگهاى بزرگ پابرجا و استوار [در زمين‌] مى‌ساختند. اى خاندان داود، به سپاسدارى [اين نعمتها] عمل [و عبادت‌] كنيد، و اندكى از بندگان من پيوسته سپاسگزارند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: (آن جنّیان) برای او آنچه می‌خواست -از محراب‌ها و مجسّمه‌ها و ظروف بزرگ مانند حوضچه‌ها و دیگ‌های فرورفته در زمین- می‌ساختند. ای خاندان داوود! شکری بزرگ انجام دهید. و اندکی از بندگانم بسیار سپاسگزارند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: They made for him whatever he wished, synagogues and statues, dishes large as water-troughs, and cauldrons firmly fixed (on ovens; and We said): "O House of David, act, and give thanks." But few among My creatures are thankful.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: They made for him whatever he wished – synagogues and statues, basins like ponds, and large pots built into the ground; “Be thankful, O the people of Dawud!” And few among My bondmen are grateful.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: fashioning for him whatsoever he would -- places of worship, statues, porringers like water-troughs, and anchored cooking-pots. 'Labour, O House of David, in thankfulness; for few indeed are those that are thankful among My servants.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: They worked for him whatsoever he pleased, of lofty halls and statues and basins like cisterns and cauldrons Standing firm. Work ye, house of Da'ud! with thanksgiving; few of My bondmen are thankful.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: They worked for him what he desired, (making) high rooms, images, basins as large as reservoirs, and (cooking) cauldrons fixed (in their places). "Work you, O family of Dawud (David), with thanks!" But few of My slaves are grateful.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: They made for him whatever he wished: sanctuaries, statues, bowls like pools, and heavy cauldrons. “O House of David, work with appreciation,” but a few of My servants are appreciative.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: They made for him whatever he would desire: stately buildings, images, basins like water-troughs and huge, built-in-cauldrons: “Work, O house of David, in thankfulness (to your Lord). Few of My servants are truly thankful.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: They worked for him as he desired on Maharib, Tamathil, large basins like Jawab and Qudur Rasiyat. "Work you, O family of Dawud, with thanks!" But few of My servants are grateful.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: They made for him what he willed: synagogues and statues, basins like wells and boilers built into the ground. Give thanks, O House of David! Few of My bondmen are thankful.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: They built for him as many temples as he wished, and figures, basins like cisterns, and caldrons fixed [in the ground]. ‘O House of David, act thankfully, and few of My servants are grateful.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: They made for him whatever he wanted, arches, statues, bowls as basins, and fixed cauldrons. (We said:) 'Give thanks, House of David and work' Yet only a few of My worshipers are thankful.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: They made for him what he willed of elevated chambers, statues, bowls like reservoirs, and stationary kettles. [We said], "Work, O family of David, in gratitude." And few of My servants are grateful.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They would make for him anything that he wanted like fortresses, statues, large basins like reservoirs, and huge immovable cooking pots. It was said, "Family of David, worship and act gratefully. Only few of my servants are grateful."

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: They made for him what he pleased of fortresses and images, and bowls (large) as watering-troughs and cooking-pots that will not move from their place; give thanks, O family of Dawood! and very few of My servants are grateful.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: YaAAmaloona lahu ma yashao min mahareeba watamatheela wajifanin kaaljawabi waqudoorin rasiyatin iAAmaloo ala dawooda shukran waqaleelun min AAibadiya alshshakooru

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: They made for him whatever he desired: palaces and statues, basins like reservoirs, and large cooking vessels fixed in their places. We said, "Give thanks, house of David, for few of My servants are truly grateful."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: They worked for him as he desired, (making) arches, images, basons as large as reservoirs, and (cooking) cauldrons fixed (in their places): "Work ye, sons of David, with thanks! but few of My servants are grateful!"

verses.text: فَلَمَّا قَضَيْنَا عَلَيْهِ‌ الْمَوْتَ‌ مَا دَلَّهُمْ‌ عَلَى‌ مَوْتِهِ‌ إِلاَّ دَابَّةُ الْأَرْضِ‌ تَأْکُلُ‌ مِنْسَأَتَهُ‌ فَلَمَّا خَرَّ تَبَيَّنَتِ‌ الْجِنُ‌ أَنْ‌ لَوْ کَانُوا يَعْلَمُونَ‌ الْغَيْبَ‌ مَا لَبِثُوا فِي‌ الْعَذَابِ‌ الْمُهِينِ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس هنگامی که مرگ را بر او مقرّر کردیم، جنیان را از مرگش جز موریانه ای که عصایش را می خورد، آگاه نکرد؛ زمانی که به روی زمین در افتاد، جنّیان [که ادعای علم غیب داشتند] فهمیدند که اگر غیب می دانستند در آن عذاب خوارکننده [که کارهای بسیار پرزحمت و طاقت فرسا بود] درنگ نمی کردند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: چون حكم مرگ را بر او رانديم حشره‌اى از حشرات زمين مردم را بر مرگش آگاه كرد: عصايش را جويد. چون فرو افتاد، ديوها دريافتند كه اگر علم غيب مى‌دانستند، در آن عذاب خواركننده نمى‌ماندند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: [سليمان با اين قدرت‌] هنگامى كه مرگ را براى او مقرر داشتيم، آنها را به مرگ او آگاه نساخت مگر موريانه‌اى كه عصاى او را مى‌خورد. پس چون [پيكرش‌] فرو افتاد، جنّيان دريافتند كه اگر غيب مى‌دانستند، در عذاب خفت بار نمى‌ماندند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس چون مرگ را بر او مقرر داشتيم، جز جنبنده‌اى خاكى [=موريانه‌] كه عصاى او را [به تدريج‌] مى‌خورد، [آدميان را] از مرگ او آگاه نگردانيد، پس چون [سليمان‌] فرو افتاد براى جنيان روشن گرديد كه اگر غيب مى‌دانستند، در آن عذاب خفت‌آور [باقى‌] نمى‌ماندند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و چون ما بر سلیمان مرگ را مأمور ساختیم (دیوان را) بر مرگ او به جز حیوان زمین (موریانه) که عصای او را می‌خورد (و جسد سلیمان که تا یک سال بر آن عصا تکیه داشت بر روی زمین افتاد) کسی دیگر به مرگ او رهبر نگشت. پس چون جسد سلیمان به زمین افتاد دیوان که از مرگ سلیمان آگاه شدند اگر از اسرار غیب آگاه بودند تا دیر زمانی در عذاب و ذلّت و خواری باقی نمی‌ماندند (و از اعمال شاقّه‌ای که به اجبار انجام می‌دادند همان دم که سلیمان مرد دست می‌کشیدند).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: زمانی که بر سلیمان (که سمبل قدرت و عظمت بود) مرگ مقرّر داشتیم، جنّیان را از مرگ او نیاگاهانید مگر موریانه‌هائی که (مدّتها بود به عصای سلیمان رخنه کرده بودند و) عصای وی را می‌خوردند. هنگامی که سلیمان (که در میان جنّیان بر عصای خود تکیه زده بود و کارهای ایشان را می‌پائید) فرو افتاد، فهمیدند که اگر آنان از غیب مطّلع می‌بودند، در عذاب خوار کننده (ی بیگاری و اسارت) باقی نمی‌ماندند (و راه خود را در پیش می‌گرفتند). [[«قَضَیْنَا»: مقرّر داشتیم. واجب گرداندیم. فرمان صادر کردیم. «دَآبَّةُ الأرْضِ»: موریانه. چوبخواره. چوبخوارک. واژه (أَرْض) به معنی (أَکْل) یعنی خوردن است. یا این که جمع (أَرَضَة) به معنی موریانه بوده و در نتیجه (دَآبَّةُ الأرْضِ) معنی موریانه‌ها و چوبخواره‌ها و چوبخوارکها دارد. «مِنسَأَة»: عصا. «تَبَیَّنَتْ»: فهمیدند و دانستند. این فعل از افعال ذو وجهین است و در اینجا به صورت متعدّی به کار رفته است. فاعل آن (الْجِنُّ) و مفعول آن جمله (أَن لَّوْ کَانُوا یَعْلَمُونَ الْغَیْبَ ...) می‌باشد. «لَوْ کَانُوا یَعْلَمُونَ الْغَیْبَ»: اشاره به این است که جنّیان که مردمان این همه خوارق و اوهام بدیشان نسبت می‌دهند، و گویا فالگیران و کاهنان و دیگر شیادان، سحر و جادو را با استمداد از ایشان می‌کنند، و بالاخره از غیب آگاهشان می‌دانند، قرآن آنان را در کار غیب همچون انسانها ناتوان و درمانده معرّفی می‌فرماید. «الْعَذَابِ الْمُهِینِ»: چه بسا اشاره به کارهای سنگین و سختی باشد که سلیمان گاهی به عنوان جریمه و مجازات بر عهده گروهی از جنّیان می‌گذاشت. یا این که عدم آزادی، خودش عذاب خوار کننده و کمرشکنی است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و چون مرگ او را مقرر داشتیم، چیزی جز کرم چوب‌خواره، مرگ او را به آنان نشان نداد، که عصایش را خورد و چون [جسدش‌] در افتاد، جنیان پی بردند که اگر غیب می‌دانستند، در آن رنج و عذاب خفت‌بار نمی‌ماندند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (با این همه جلال و شکوه سلیمان) هنگامی که مرگ را بر او مقرّر داشتیم، کسی آنها را از مرگ وی آگاه نساخت مگر جنبنده زمین [= موریانه‌] که عصای او را می‌خورد (تا شکست و پیکر سلیمان فرو افتاد)؛ هنگامی که بر زمین افتاد جنّیان فهمیدند که اگر از غیب آگاه بودند در عذاب خوارکننده باقی نمی‌ماندند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس هنگامی که گذراندیم بر او مرگ را رهبریشان نکرد بر مرگش جز جنبنده زمین که می‌خورد چوبدستش را تا گاهی که به روی در افتاد دریافتند پریان که اگر می‌دانستند ناپیدا را نمی‌ماندند در عذابی خوارکننده‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس چون فرمان مرگ را بر او رانديم، آنان را بر مرگ او رهنمونى نكرد مگر جنبنده زمين- كرم چوب‌خوار موريانه- كه عصايش را مى‌خورد، پس چون [سليمان‌] بيفتاد ديوان دريافتند كه اگر غيب مى‌دانستند- از مرگ سليمان آگاهى داشتند- در آن عذاب خواركننده درنگ نمى‌كردند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس چون مرگ را بر او مقرّر داشتیم، جز جنبنده‌ای خاکی [:موریانه]، حال آنکه عصای او را می‌خورد، جنّیان را از مرگ او آگاه نگردانید. پس چون سلیمان فرو افتاد برای جنّیان روشن گردید که اگر غیب می‌دانستند، در عذاب خفّت‌بار (باقی) نمی‌ماندند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: When We ordained (Solomon's) death, none but the weevil, that was eating away his staff (on which he rested), pointed out to them that he was dead. When he fell down (dead) the jinns realised that if they had knowledge of the Unknown they would never have suffered demeaning labour.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So when We sent the command of death towards him, no one revealed his death to the jinns except the termite of the earth which ate his staff; and when he came to the ground, the truth about the jinns was exposed – if they had known the hidden, they would not have remained in the disgraceful toil.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And when We decreed that he should die, naught indicated to them that he was dead but the Beast of the Earth devouring his staff; and when he fell down, the jinn saw clearly that, had they only known the Unseen, they would not have continued in the humbling chastisement.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then when We decreed death for him, naught discovered his death to them' save a moving creature of the earth which gnawed away his staff. Then when he fell, the Jinn clearly perceived that, if they had known the unseen they would not have tarried in the ignominious torment.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then when We decreed death for him [Sulaiman (Solomon)], nothing informed them (jinns) of his death except a little worm of the earth, which kept (slowly) gnawing away at his stick, so when he fell down, the jinns saw clearly that if they had known the unseen, they would not have stayed in the humiliating torment.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Then, when We decreed death for him, nothing indicated his death to them except an earthworm eating at his staff. Then, when he fell down, it became clear to the sprites that, had they known the unseen, they would not have remained in the demeaning torment.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: When We executed Our decree of death on Solomon, nothing indicated to the jinn that he was dead except a worm eating away his staff. So when Solomon fell down, the jinn realised that had they known what lies in the realm beyond perception, they would not have continued to be in this humiliating chastisement.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then when We decreed death for him, nothing informed them (Jinn) of his death except a little worm of the earth which kept (slowly) gnawing away at his stick. So when he fell down, the Jinn saw clearly that if they had known the Unseen, they would not have stayed in the humiliating torment.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And when We decreed death for him, nothing showed his death to them save a creeping creature of the earth which gnawed away his staff. And when he fell the jinn saw clearly how, if they had known the Unseen, they would not have continued in despised toil.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: When We decreed death for him, nothing apprised them of his death except a worm which gnawed away at his staff. And when he fell down, [the humans] realized that had the jinn known the Unseen, they would not have remained in a humiliating torment.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: And when We decreed (Solomon's) death, they had no indication that he was dead until (they saw a termite), a crawler of the earth eating away his staff. And when he fell down, the jinn realized that had they known the unseen, they would not have continued in their humiliating punishment.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And when We decreed for Solomon death, nothing indicated to the jinn his death except a creature of the earth eating his staff. But when he fell, it became clear to the jinn that if they had known the unseen, they would not have remained in humiliating punishment.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: When We decreed that Solomon should die, no one knew of his death except for a creeping creature of the earth who ate-up his staff. When he fell down, the jinn realized that if they had known about the unseen, they would not have remained in such a humiliating torment for so long.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: But when We decreed death for him, naught showed them his death but a creature of the earth that ate away his staff; and when it fell down, the jinn came to know plainly that if they had known the unseen, they would not have tarried in abasing torment.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Falamma qadayna AAalayhi almawta ma dallahum AAala mawtihi illa dabbatu alardi takulu minsaatahu falamma kharra tabayyanati aljinnu an law kanoo yaAAlamoona alghayba ma labithoo fee alAAathabi almuheeni

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: When We decreed Solomon's death, nothing indicated his death to them except a worm from the earth, which was eating away at his cane. When he fell down, the jinn plainly realized that if they had known what was unseen, they would not have had to continue with such humiliating labour.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Then, when We decreed (Solomon's) death, nothing showed them his death except a little worm of the earth, which kept (slowly) gnawing away at his staff: so when he fell down, the Jinns saw plainly that if they had known the unseen, they would not have tarried in the humiliating Penalty (of their Task).

verses.text: لَقَدْ کَانَ‌ لِسَبَإٍ فِي‌ مَسْکَنِهِمْ‌ آيَةٌ جَنَّتَانِ‌ عَنْ‌ يَمِينٍ‌ وَ شِمَالٍ‌ کُلُوا مِنْ‌ رِزْقِ‌ رَبِّکُمْ‌ وَ اشْکُرُوا لَهُ‌ بَلْدَةٌ طَيِّبَةٌ وَ رَبٌ‌ غَفُورٌ

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: یقیناً برای قوم سبا در جای اقامتشان نشانه ای [از قدرت و رحمت خدا] وجود داشت، دو باغ از طرف راست و چپ. [گفتیم:] از رزق و روزی پروردگارتان بخورید، و برای او سپاس گزاری کنید، سرزمینی خوش و دلپذیر [دارید]، و پروردگاری بسیار آمرزنده

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: مردم سبا را در مساكنشان عبرتى بود: دو بوستان داشتند، يكى از جانب راست و يكى از جانب چپ. از آنچه پروردگارتان به شما روزى داده است بخوريد و شكر او به جاى آوريد. شهرى خوش و پاكيزه و پروردگارى آمرزنده.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: همانا براى [مردم‌] سبأ در محل سكونتشان نشانه [رحمتى‌] بود دو باغستان داشتند در جانب راست و چپ، [گفتيم:] از روزى پروردگارتان بخوريد و او را شكر كنيد كه شهرى است پاكيزه و پروردگارى آمرزگار

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: قطعاً براى [مردم‌] سبا در محل سكونتشان نشانه [رحمتى‌] بود: دو باغستان از راست و چپ [به آنان گفتيم:] از روزى پروردگارتان بخوريد و او را شكر كنيد. شهرى است خوش و خدايى آمرزنده.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و برای (اولاد و قوم) سبا در وطنشان (سرزمین یمن و شام) از راست و چپ (جنوب و شمال) دو سلسله باغ و بوستان آیتی (از لطف و رحمت حق) بود (همه پر نعمت، و به آنها گفتیم که) بخورید از رزق خدای خود و شکر وی به جای آرید، که مسکنتان شهری نیکو و پر نعمت است و خدای شما غفور (و مهربان) است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: برای اهالی سبا در محلّ سکونتشان نشانه‌ای (از قدرت خدا) بود. دو باغ (عظیم و گسترده) در سمت راست و چپ (شهر یمن، با میوه‌های فراوان. بدیشان گفته شد:) از روزی پروردگارتان بخورید و شکر او را به جای آورید. شهری است پاک و پاکیزه، و (پربرکت و نعمت، و آفریدگارتان) پروردگاری است بس آمرزنده. [[«سَبَإٍ»: قبیله مشهور سَبَأ. شهر سبأ. ساکنان شهر سبأ. «مَسْکَنِهِمْ»: محلّ سکونت ایشان که مأرب است و در 100 کیلومتری صنعاء قرار دارد. «آیَةٌ»: نشانه قدرت خداوند تعالی. «جَنَّتَانِ»: دو باغ. مراد باغهای فراوان و متّصل به هم است. بدل از (آیَة) یا خبر مبتدای محذوف و تقدیر چنین است: هِیَ جَنَّتَانِ، و یا این که مبتدا است و خبر آن محذوف بوده و در اصل چنین است: هُنَاکَ جَنَّتَانِ. «بَلْدَةٌ»: شهر. خبر مبتدای محذوف است و تقدیر چنین است. هذِهِ بَلْدَةٌ.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: برای قوم سبا در مسکنهایشان پدیده شگرفی بود [از جمله‌] دو بوستان در جانب راست و چپ، [که به ایشان گفتیم‌] از روزی پروردگارتان بخورید، و او را سپاس بگزارید، [شما را] شهری پاکیزه و پروردگاری آمرزگار است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: برای قوم «سبا» در محل سکونتشان نشانه‌ای (از قدرت الهی) بود: دو باغ (بزرگ و گسترده) از راست و چپ (رودخانه عظیم با میوه‌های فراوان؛ و به آنها گفتیم:) از روزی پروردگارتان بخورید و شکر او را بجا آورید؛ شهری است پاک و پاکیزه، و پروردگاری آمرزنده (و مهربان)!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: همانا بود سبا را در نشیمنشان آیتی دو باغ از راست و چپ بخورید از روزی پروردگار خویش و سپاس گزارید برایش شهری پاکیزه و پروردگاری آمرزگار

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: هر آينه مردم سبا- در يمن- را در جاى سكونتشان نشانه‌اى- بر قدرت خداوند- بود: دو بوستان، از دست راست و از دست چپ [مسكنهاشان قرار داشت‌]. [گفتيم:] از روزى پروردگارتان بخوريد و او را سپاس گزاريد، شهرى است خوش [و پر نعمت‌] و خداوندى آمرزگار.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: همواره برای (مردمان) سبا در محلّ سکونتشان بس نشانه‌ای (رحمت‌بار) بود: دو باغ از راست و چپ. (به آنان گفتیم:) «از روزی پروردگارتان بخورید و برای او شکر کنید. (این) شهری است پاکیزه و (آن) خدایی است بس پوشاننده.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: There was a sign for the people of Saba in their habitations: Two gardens, on the right and left. (And they were told:) "Eat of what your Lord has given you and be thankful. Fair is your land, and forgiving your Lord."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Indeed for (the tribe of) Saba was a sign in their dwelling-place – two gardens on the right and the left; “Eat the sustenance provided by your Lord and be grateful to Him”; a pure land and an Oft Forgiving Lord!

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: For Sheba also there was a sign in their dwelling-place -- two gardens, one on the right and one on the left: 'Eat of your Lord's provision, and give thanks to Him; a good land, and a Lord All-forgiving.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Assuredly there was for Saba a sign in their own dwelling- place: two gardens on the right hand and on the left. And it was said Unto them: eat ye of the provision of your Lord and give thanks Unto Him: a fair land' and a forgiving Lord.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Indeed there was for Saba' (Sheba) a sign in their dwelling place, - two gardens on the right hand and on the left (and it was said to them) "Eat of the provision of your Lord, and be grateful to Him, a fair land and an OftForgiving Lord.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: In Sheba’s homeland there used to be a wonder: two gardens, on the right, and on the left. “Eat of your Lord’s provision, and give thanks to Him.” A good land, and a forgiving Lord.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: For Sheba there was also a Sign in their dwelling place: the two gardens to the right and to the left. “Eat of your Lord's provision, and render thanks to Him. Most pleasant is your land and Most Forgiving is your Lord.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Indeed there was for Saba' a sign in their dwelling place -- two gardens on the right and on the left; (and it was said to them:) "Eat of the provision of your Lord, and be grateful to Him." A fair land and an Oft-Forgiving Lord!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: There was indeed a sign for Sheba in their dwelling-place: Two gardens on the right hand and the left (as who should say): Eat of the provision of your Lord and render thanks to Him. A fair land and an indulgent Lord!

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: There was certainly a sign for Sheba in their habitation: two gardens, to the right and to the left. ‘Eat of the provision of your Lord and give Him thanks: a good land and an all-forgiving Lord!’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: For Sheba there was indeed a sign. In their dwelling place there were two gardens, on the right and left side. (We said): 'Eat of your Lord's provisions and give thanks to Him, a good land, and a Lord who is the Forgiving'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: There was for [the tribe of] Saba' in their dwelling place a sign: two [fields of] gardens on the right and on the left. [They were told], "Eat from the provisions of your Lord and be grateful to Him. A good land [have you], and a forgiving Lord."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: There was evidence (of the truth) for the people of Sheba in their homeland. (We gave them) two gardens, one on the left and one on the right and (told them), "Consume the sustenance which your Lord has given to you and give Him thanks. You have a blessed land and an All-forgiving Lord".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Certainly there was a sign for Saba in their abode; two gardens on the right and the left; eat of the sustenance of your Lord and give thanks to Him: a good land and a Forgiving Lord!

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Laqad kana lisabain fee maskanihim ayatun jannatani AAan yameenin washimalin kuloo min rizqi rabbikum waoshkuroo lahu baldatun tayyibatun warabbun ghafoorun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: For the people of Sheba there was a sign in their homeland: two gardens, one on the right hand and the other on the left. We said to them: "Eat what your Lord has provided for you, and be grateful. You have a good land and a Lord most forgiving."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: There was, for Saba, aforetime, a Sign in their home-land - two Gardens to the right and to the left. "Eat of the Sustenance (provided) by your Lord, and be grateful to Him: a territory fair and happy, and a Lord Oft-Forgiving!

verses.text: فَأَعْرَضُوا فَأَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ‌ سَيْلَ‌ الْعَرِمِ‌ وَ بَدَّلْنَاهُمْ‌ بِجَنَّتَيْهِمْ‌ جَنَّتَيْنِ‌ ذَوَاتَيْ‌ أُکُلٍ‌ خَمْطٍ وَ أَثْلٍ‌ وَ شَيْ‌ءٍ مِنْ‌ سِدْرٍ قَلِيلٍ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: ولی [آنان از سپاس گزاری در برابر نعمت، و از فرمان ها او و دعوت پیامبرشان] روی گرداندند، در نتیجه سیل [ویران گر] «عرم» را بر ضد آنان جاری کردیم [که دو باغ آباد راست و چپ منطقه را نابود کرد]، و ما آن دو باغ پر حاصلشتان را به دو باغستانی تبدیل کردیم که دارای میوه هایی تلخ و درخت شوره گز و چیزی اندک از درخت سدر بودند!!

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اعراض كردند. ما نيز سيل ويرانگر را بر آنها فرستاديم و دو بوستانشان را به دو بوستان بدل كرديم با ميوه‌اى تلخ و شوره‌گز و اندكى سدر.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: ولى روى گردانيدند پس بر آنها سيل ويرانگر فرستاديم، و دو باغستان آنها را به دو باغى با ميوه‌هاى تلخ و شورگز و اندكى از درخت سدر مبدل ساختيم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس روى گردانيدند، و بر آن سيل [سدّ] عَرِم را روانه كرديم، و دو باغستان آنها را به دو باغ كه ميوه‌هاى تلخ و شوره‌گز و نوعى از كُنار تنك داشت تبديل كرديم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: با وجود این باز (از شکر خدا و طاعت حق) اعراض کردند، ما هم سیلی سخت بر هلاک ایشان فرستادیم و به جای آن دو نوع باغ پر نعمت دو باغ دیگرشان دادیم که بار درختانش تلخ و ترش و بد طعم و شوره گز و اندکی درخت سدر بود.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: امّا آنان (از شکر نعمت) رویگردان شدند (و مغرور رفاه و لذائذ گشتند). بدین سبب ما سیل ویرانگری را به سویشان روان کردیم و باغهای (پربرکت و پرمیوه‌ی) ایشان را به باغهای (بی‌ارزش) با میوه‌های تلخ، و درختهای شوره گز و اندکی درخت سدر، مبدّل ساختیم. [[«الْعَرِمِ»: ویرانگر. در این صورت (سَیْلَ الْعَرِمِ) اضافه موصوف به صفت است. یا این که جمع عَرِمَة، به معنی سدّ است. برخی هم آن را نام درّه‌ای دانسته‌اند. «أُکُلٍ»: ثمره (نگا: رعد / 4). «خَمْطٍ»: تلخ. بدمزه. «أَثْلٍ»: گز. شوره گز. «سِدْرٍ»: نام درختی است مشهور به کُنار.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: ولی رویگردان شدند، آنگاه بر آنان سیل بنیان‌کن را روانه کردیم، و به جای آن دو بوستانشان دو بوستان دارای میوه‌های ناگوار و درخت گز و اندکمایه‌ای از درخت سدر جانشین کردیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: امّا آنها (از خدا) روی‌گردان شدند، و ما سیل ویرانگر را بر آنان فرستادیم، و دو باغ (پربرکت) شان را به دو باغ (بی‌ارزش) با میوه‌های تلخ و درختان شوره گز و اندکی درخت سدر مبدّل ساختیم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس روی برتافتند پس فرستادیم بر ایشان سیل بیکران را و بدیشان دادیم جای دو باغ ایشان دو باغ دارنده میوه (یا خوراکی) «خمط» و «اثل» و چیزی از درخت سدر اندک‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: ولى روى گردانيدند- از فرمان خدا يا از سپاسگزارى- پس سيل بسيار سخت بر آنان فرستاديم و دو بوستانشان را به دو بوستانى ديگر بدل كرديم با ميوه‌اى تلخ و شوره‌گز و اندكى از كُنار- سدر-.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس روی گردانیدند، در نتیجه بر آنان سیل (سدّ) عَرِم را روانه کردیم و دو باغ آنها را به دو باغ که میوه‌های تلخ و شوره‌گز و چیزکی از اندکی سدر داشت تبدیل کردیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: But they turned away. So We let loose on them the inundation of (the dyke of) al-'Arim, replacing their gardens with two other gardens which bore only bitter gourd, and tamarisks and a few sparse lote-trees.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: In response they turned away – We therefore sent upon them a tremendous flood, and in exchange of their two gardens gave them two gardens bearing bitter fruit, and tamarisk, and some berries.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: But they turned away; so We loosed on them the Flood of Arim, and We gave them, in exchange for their two gardens, two gardens bearing bitter produce and tamarisk-bushes, and here and there a few lote-trees.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: But they turned away. Wherefore We sent upon them the inundation of the dam and We exchanged their two gardens for two gardens bearing bitter fruit, and tamarisk. And some few lote-trees.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: But they turned away (from the obedience of Allah), so We sent against them Sail Al'Arim (flood released from the dam), and We converted their two gardens into gardens producing bitter bad fruit, and tamarisks, and some few lotetrees.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: But they turned away, so We unleashed against them the flood of the dam; and We substituted their two gardens with two gardens of bitter fruits, thorny shrubs, and meager harvest.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: But they turned away and so We let loose upon them a devastating flood that swept away the dams and replaced their gardens by two others bearing bitter fruits, tamarisks, and a few lote trees.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: But they turned away, so We sent against them flood released from the dam, and We converted their two gardens into gardens producing bitter bad fruit, and Athl, and some few lote trees.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: But they were froward, so We sent on them the flood of 'Iram, and in exchange for their two gardens gave them two gardens bearing bitter fruit, the tamarisk and here and there a lote-tree.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: But they disregarded [the path of Allah], so We unleashed upon them a violent flood and replaced their two gardens with two gardens bearing bitter fruit, tamarisk, and sparse lote trees.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: But they turned away. So We sent against them the Flood (at the city) of Arim, and exchanged their gardens with two others bearing bitter fruit andTamarisks, and here and there a few Lotus trees.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: But they turned away [refusing], so We sent upon them the flood of the dam, and We replaced their two [fields of] gardens with gardens of bitter fruit, tamarisks and something of sparse lote trees.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They ignored (the evidence) and We sent to them a flood, arising from a broken dam. Nothing was left in their gardens but bitter fruits, some tamarisk and a few lotus trees.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: But they turned aside, so We sent upon them a torrent of which the rush could not be withstood, and in place of their two gardens We gave to them two gardens yielding bitter fruit and (growing) tamarisk and a few lote-trees.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: FaaAAradoo faarsalna AAalayhim sayla alAAarimi wabaddalnahum bijannatayhim jannatayni thawatay okulin khamtin waathlin washayin min sidrin qaleelin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Yet they turned away [from the truth]. So We let loose on them a flood from the dam and replaced their two gardens by two others bearing bitter fruits, tamarisks, and a few lote trees.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: But they turned away (from Allah), and We sent against them the Flood (released) from the dams, and We converted their two garden (rows) into "gardens" producing bitter fruit, and tamarisks, and some few (stunted) Lote-trees.

verses.text: ذٰلِکَ‌ جَزَيْنَاهُمْ‌ بِمَا کَفَرُوا وَ هَلْ‌ نُجَازِي‌ إِلاَّ الْکَفُورَ

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: این [سیل ویران گر] را در برابر کفرشان به آنان کیفر دادیم. آیا جز کفران کننده را کیفر می دهیم؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آنها را كه ناسپاس بودند اينچنين جزا داديم. آيا ما جز ناسپاسان را مجازات مى‌كنيم؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: اين [عقوبت‌] را به [سزاى‌] كفرانشان به آنها داديم و آيا جز ناسپاس را مجازات مى‌كنيم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: اين [عقوبت‌] را به [سزاى‌] آنكه كفران كردند به آنان جزا داديم؛ و آيا جز ناسپاس را به مجازات مى‌رسانيم؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: این کیفر کفران آنها بود، و آیا ما تا کسی کفران نکند مجازاتش خواهیم کرد؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: این (تعویض و تبدیل،) چیزی بود که به خاطر کفران نعمت، ایشان را بدان کیفر دادیم. مگر ما جز ناسپاس را مجازات می‌کنیم؟ [[«هَلْ نُجَازِی؟»: آیا مجازات می‌کنیم و کیفر می‌دهیم؟]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: به خاطر کفرانی که ورزیده بودند این گونه جز ایشان دادیم، و آیا جز ناسپاس را کیفر می‌دهیم؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: این کیفر را بخاطر کفرانشان به آنها دادیم؛ و آیا جز کفران کننده را کیفر می‌دهیم؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: این را پاداششان دادیم بدانچه کفر ورزیدند و آیا کیفر همی‌دهیم جز به کفرورزنده‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آن [كيفر] را به سزاى آنكه كافر شدند و ناسپاسى كردند به آنان داديم، و آيا جز ناسپاس را كيفر مى‌دهيم؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: این (عقوبت) را به (سزای) آنچه کفر و کفران کردند به آنان جزا دادیم‌. و آیا جز کافرِ بس ‌ناسپاس را مجازات می‌کنیم‌؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: That is how We requited them for their ingratitude. We only punish those who are ungrateful.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: We gave them this reward – the recompense of their ingratitude; and whom do We punish, except the ungrateful?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Thus We recompensed them for their unbelief; and do 'We ever recompense any hut the unbeliever?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: In this wise We requited them for they were ungrateful. And We requite not thus any save the ungrateful infidels.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Like this We requited them because they were ungrateful disbelievers. And never do We requit in such a way except those who are ungrateful, (disbelievers).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: We thus penalized them for their ingratitude. Would We penalize any but the ungrateful?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Thus did We retribute them for their ingratitude. And none do We retribute in this manner except the utterly ungrateful.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Like this We requited them because they were ungrateful disbelievers. And never do We requite in such a way except those who are ungrateful (disbelievers).

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: This We awarded them because of their ingratitude. Punish We ever any save the ingrates?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: We requited them with that for their ingratitude. Do We not requite ingrates?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: As such We recompensed them for their disbelief; do We recompense any except the unbelievers?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [By] that We repaid them because they disbelieved. And do We [thus] repay except the ungrateful?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: This was how We recompensed them for their ungratefulness and thus do We recompense the ungrateful ones.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: This We requited them with because they disbelieved; and We do not punish any but the ungrateful.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Thalika jazaynahum bima kafaroo wahal nujazee illa alkafoora

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We requited them in that way because of their ingratitude. We requite no one in that way but the ungrateful.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: That was the Requital We gave them because they ungratefully rejected Faith: and never do We give (such) requital except to such as are ungrateful rejecters.

verses.text: وَ جَعَلْنَا بَيْنَهُمْ‌ وَ بَيْنَ‌ الْقُرَى‌ الَّتِي‌ بَارَکْنَا فِيهَا قُرًى‌ ظَاهِرَةً وَ قَدَّرْنَا فِيهَا السَّيْرَ سِيرُوا فِيهَا لَيَالِيَ‌ وَ أَيَّاماً آمِنِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و میان مردم سبا و شهرهایی که در آن ها برکت نهادیم، آبادی های به هم پیوسته و نمایان قرار دادیم، و سیر و سفر را در [میان] آنان متناسب و به اندازه مقرّر داشتیم، [و گفتیم:] شب ها و روزها با امنیت در آنها مسافرت کنید.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: ميان آنان و قريه‌هايى كه بركت داده بوديم، قريه‌هايى آبادان و بر سر راه پديد آورديم. و منزلهاى برابر معين كرديم. در آن راه‌ها ايمن از گزند، شبها و روزها سفر كنيد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و ميان آنها و ميان شهرهايى كه در آنها بركت نهاده بوديم، آبادى‌هايى پيدا [و نزديك به هم‌] پديد آورديم، و در آنها سير و سفر را به اندازه كرديم [و فاصله‌ها برابر بود، و گفتيم:] شب‌ها و روزها به ايمنى در آنها سفر كنيد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و ميان آنان و ميان آبادانيهايى كه در آنها بركت نهاده بوديم شهرهاى متصل به هم قرار داده بوديم، و در ميان آنها مسافت را، به اندازه، مقرر داشته بوديم. در اين [راه‌]ها، شبان و روزان آسوده‌خاطر بگرديد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و ما به میان آنها و شهرهایی که پر نعمت و برکت گردانیدیم باز قریه‌هایی نزدیک به هم قرار دادیم با فاصله کوتاه و سیر سفری معیّن (و آنها را گفتیم که) در این ده و شهرهای نزدیک به هم شبان و روزان با ایمنی کامل مسافرت کنید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: میان آنان و شهرهای دیگری که پربرکت و نعمت کرده بودیم، شهرکها و روستاهائی ساخته و پرداخته بودیم که (از یکی، دیگری) نمایان بود، و در میان آنها فاصله‌های مناسب و نزدیک به هم ترتیب داده بودیم (به گونه‌ای که امنیّت برقرار بود و نیازی هم به حمل آب و توشه‌ی سفر دیده نمی‌شد. توسّط انبیاء بدیشان پیام دادیم که) شبها و روزها در امن و امان در آنجاها سیر و سفر کنند (و از حق منحرف نشوند و به یاد الطاف خدا باشند و پرستش او را فراموش ننمایند). [[«قُریً ظَاهِرَةً»: شهرها و روستاهائی که به هم نزدیک و از یکدیگر نمایان باشند. «قَدَّرْنا»: مقدور کردیم. نظم و نظام بخشیدیم و سر و سامان دادیم. مراد تنظیم فواصل و ترتیب محلّهای غذاخوری و استراحت شبانه و روزانه است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و در بین آنان و آبادیهایی که به آنها برکت بخشیده بودیم، آبادیهای به هم پیوسته قرار داده بودیم، و در میان آنها سیر و سفر مقرر داشته بودیم، و [به آنان می‌گفتیم‌] شبها و روزها با کمال امن و امان در آنها سیر و سفر کنید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و میان آنها و شهرهایی که برکت داده بودیم، آبادیهای آشکاری قرار دادیم؛ و سفر در میان آنها را بطور متناسب (با فاصله نزدیک) مقرّر داشتیم؛ (و به آنان گفتیم:) شبها و روزها در این آبادیها با ایمنی (کامل) سفر کنید!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و گذاردیم میان ایشان و میان شهرستانی که برکت نهاده بودیم در آنها شهرهائی پدیدار و مقرّر کردیم در آنها راه‌پیمودن را بروید در آنها شبهائی و روزهائی ایمن‌شدگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و ميان آنان و آباديهايى كه در آنها بركت نهاده بوديم- سرزمين شام- آباديهاى پيدا و پيوسته پديد آورديم، و در آنها آمد و شد را به اندازه كرديم- فاصله آباديها برابر بود-، [و گفتيم:] در آنها شبها و روزها ايمن و بى‌بيم رفت و آمد كنيد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و میان آنان و میان آبادی‌های(شان) که در آنها برکت نهاده بودیم، آبادی‌هایی آشکارِ متصل به هم قرار دادیم و در میان آنها پیمایش را، به‌اندازه‌، مقرّر داشتیم. (و گفتیم:) «در این راه‌ها، شبها و روزها در امان بگردید.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Between them and the cities We had blessed We placed towns along the highway, and made them stages on their journey, (saying): "Travel between them in safety by day or by night."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And We had made several towns upon the road between them and the towns which We had blessed – and kept them according to the length of the journey; “Travel safely in them, by night and by day.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And We set, between them and the cities that We have blessed, cities apparent and well We measured the journey between them: 'Journey among them by night and day in security!'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And We had placed between them and the cities" which We had blest cities easy to be seen, and We had made the stages of journey between them easy:" travel in them nights and days secure.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And We placed between them and the towns which We had blessed, towns easy to be seen, and We made the stages (of journey) between them easy (saying): "Travel in them safely both by night and day."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Between them and the towns We had blessed, We placed prominent towns, and We made the travel between them easy. “Travel between them by night and day, in safety.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: We placed other prominent towns between them, the towns that We had blessed and had set well-measured stages between them. Move back and forth between them, night and day, in perfect security.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And We placed, between them and the towns which We had blessed, towns easy to be seen, and We made the stages (of journey) between them easy (saying): "Travel in them safely both by night and day."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And We set, between them and the towns which We had blessed, towns easy to be seen, and We made the stage between them easy, (saying): Travel in them safely both by night and day.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: We had placed between them and the towns which We had blessed hamlets prominent [from the main route], and We had ordained the course through them: ‘Travel through them in safety, night and day.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Between them and the villages which We had blessed, We placed easily visible villages, and We spaced the journey between them exactly. (We said):'Travel through them by day and night in safety'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And We placed between them and the cities which We had blessed [many] visible cities. And We determined between them the [distances of] journey, [saying], "Travel between them by night or day in safety."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We established between them and the town that We had blessed, other towns nearby, and thus made it easier to travel. We told them, "Travel there safely day and night".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And We made between them and the towns which We had blessed (other) towns to be easily seen, and We apportioned the journey therein: Travel through them nights and days, secure.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: WajaAAalna baynahum wabayna alqura allatee barakna feeha quran thahiratan waqaddarna feeha alssayra seeroo feeha layaliya waayyaman amineena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We had placed between them and the towns that We had blessed, other towns situated close to each other, and We fixed the stages [of journey] between them, saying, "Travel between them in safety by night and day,"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Between them and the Cities on which We had poured our blessings, We had placed Cities in prominent positions, and between them We had appointed stages of journey in due proportion: "Travel therein, secure, by night and by day."

verses.text: فَقَالُوا رَبَّنَا بَاعِدْ بَيْنَ‌ أَسْفَارِنَا وَ ظَلَمُوا أَنْفُسَهُمْ‌ فَجَعَلْنَاهُمْ‌ أَحَادِيثَ‌ وَ مَزَّقْنَاهُمْ‌ کُلَ‌ مُمَزَّقٍ‌ إِنَ‌ فِي‌ ذٰلِکَ‌ لَآيَاتٍ‌ لِکُلِ‌ صَبَّارٍ شَکُورٍ

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس [این مغرورشدگان به رفاه و خوشی و ناسپاسان در برابر نعمت] گفتند: پروردگارا! میان سفرهای ما، دوری و فاصله انداز. [این را درخواست کردند تا تهیدستان و پا برهنگان نتوانند در کنار آنان سفر کنند]، و [این گونه آنان] بر خودشان ستم کردند، پس ما آنان را داستان هایی [برای عبرت آیندگان] قرار دادیم و جمعشان را به شدت متلاشی و تار و مار کردیم، همانا در این [سرگذشت ها] برای هر صبرکننده سپاس گزاری عبرت هاست

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: بر خويشتن ستم كردند و گفتند: اى پروردگار ما، منزلگاه‌هاى ما را از هم دور گردان. ما نيز افسانه روزگارشان گردانيديم و سخت پراكنده‌شان ساختيم و در اين عبرتهاست براى شكيبايان سپاسگزار.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: ولى [اين مردم ناسپاس‌] گفتند: پروردگارا! ميان سفرهايمان دورى افكن [تا درويش و غنى متمايز شوند]، و بر خويشتن ستم كردند پس آنها را افسانه‌هايى [عبرت‌آموز] گردانيديم، و سخت تار و مارشان كرديم. قطعا در اين [ماجرا] براى هر صبر پيشه‌ى سپاسگزارى عبرت‌هاست

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: تا گفتند: «پروردگارا، ميان [منزلهاى‌] سفرهايمان فاصله انداز.» و بر خويشتن ستم كردند. پس آنها را [براى آيندگان، موضوع‌] حكايتها گردانيديم، و سخت تارومارشان كرديم؛ قطعاً در اين [ماجرا] براى هر شكيباى سپاسگزارى عبرتهاست.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: باز آنها گفتند: بار الها، سفرهای ما را دور و دراز گردان، و (به این تقاضای بی‌جا) بر خویش ستم کردند، ما هم آنها را داستانها و مثلهای عبرت آموز کردیم و به کلی متفرق و پراکنده ساختیم. در این عقوبت برای مردمان پر صبر و شکر آیاتی (از عبرت و حکمت) آشکار است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: امّا ایشان (مست و مغرور نعمت و قدرت گشتند و همچون بنی‌اسرائیل از خوشیها سیر شدند و) گفتند: پروردگارا! فاصله‌های (منازل) سفرهای ما را زیاد بفرما (تا فقرای بی‌سروپا نتوانند همچون ما اغنیاء سفر کنند.) و بدین وسیله به خود ستم کردند و (ما چنان زندگانی ایشان را پریشان کردیم و در هم پیچیدیم که) آنان را سخنانی (بر سر زبانها) نمودیم، و سخت متلاشیشان ساختیم (و هر کدام را به گوشه‌ای از جهان پرت کردیم). قطعاً در این سرگذشت، نشانه‌های عبرت برای همه‌ی شکیبایان سپاسگزار است. [[«بَاعِدْ»: دور کن. فاصله بینداز. «بَاعِدْ بَیْنَ أَسْفَارِنَا»: این درخواست به درخواست بیجای بنی‌اسرائیل می‌ماند که می‌گفتند: کو سیر و پیاز؟!. (نگا: بقره / 61). چه بسا مراد از این خواست، توسعه طلبی و گسترش منطقه نفوذ و قدرت، یعنی چیزی نزدیک به مفهوم امپریالیسم امروزی باشد. «أَحَادِیثَ»: مراد سخنانی است که بر سر زبانها و نقل مجالس بوده و به عنوان افسانه عبرت و ضرب‌المثل نابودی قدرت روایت می‌شده است. «مَزَّقْنَاهُمْ ...»: (نگا: سبأ / 7).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: پس گفتند پروردگارا بین سفرهای ما فاصله انداز، و بدین‌سان بر خویشتن ستم کردند، آنگاه همچون افسانه‌شان گرداندیم و پاره و پراکنده‌شان ساختیم، بی‌گمان در این برای هر شکیبای شاکری مایه‌های عبرت است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: ولی (این ناسپاس مردم) گفتند: «پروردگارا! میان سفرهای ما دوری بیفکن» (تا بینوایان نتوانند دوش به دوش اغنیا سفر کنند! و به این طریق) آنها به خویشتن ستم کردند! و ما آنان را داستانهایی (برای عبرت دیگران) قرار دادیم و جمعیّتشان را متلاشی ساختیم؛ در این ماجرا، نشانه‌های عبرتی برای هر صابر شکرگزار است.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس گفتند پروردگارا دوری افکن میان سفرهای ما و ستم کردند خویش را پس گردانیدیمشان داستانهائی و پریشان (پراکنده) ساختیمشان مُنتهای پریشانی را همانا در این است آیتهائی برای هر شکیبائی سپاسگزار

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: ولى گفتند: پروردگارا، ميان شهرهاى ما دورى افكن و بر خويشتن ستم كردند. پس آنان را افسانه‌ها و داستانها كرديم و سخت پراكنده‌شان ساختيم. هر آينه در اين- سرگذشت آنها- براى هر شكيباى سپاسگزارى نشانه‌ها و عبرتهاست.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس (از آن) گفتند: «پروردگارمان! میان (جایگاه‌های) سفرهایمان فاصله بینداز.» و بر خویشتن ستم کردند. پس آنها را (برای آیندگان، نمونه‌ی) حکایت‌هایی تازه گردانیدیم و به کلی تار و مارشان کردیم. بی‌چون در این (ماجرا) برای هر شکیبایی بس سپاسگزار نشانه‌هایی است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: But they said: "O Lord, make the distance between the stages of our journeys longer;" but (by doing so) they wronged themselves. So We turned them into bygone tales, and dispersed them, scattered in all directions. Surely there are signs in this for those who endeavour and are grateful.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So they said, “Our Lord! Make the stage between our journeys longer” and they wronged themselves – We therefore turned them into fables and scattered them completely with adversity; indeed in this are signs for every greatly enduring, most grateful person.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: But they said, 'Our Lord, prolong the stages of our travel'; and they wronged themselves, so We made them as but tales, and We tore them utterly to pieces. Surely in that are signs for every man enduring, thankful.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then they said: Our Lord make the distance between our journeys longer. And they wronged themselves. Wherefore We made them by words and dispersed them with a total dispersion. Verily herein are signs for every persevering, grateful persons.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: But they said: "Our Lord! Make the stages between our journey longer," and they wronged themselves, so We made them as tales (in the land), and We dispersed them all, totally. Verily, in this are indeed signs for every steadfast grateful (person).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: But they said, “Our Lord, lengthen the distances of our journeys.” They wronged themselves; so We made them history, and We scattered them in every direction. In this are lessons for every steadfast and appreciative person.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: But they said: “Lord, make the stages of our journeys longer.” They wronged their own selves so We reduced them to bygone tales, and utterly tore them to pieces. Verily there are Signs in this for everyone who is steadfast and thankful.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: But they said: "Our Lord! Make the stages between our journey longer," and they wronged themselves; so We made them as tales (in the land), and We dispersed them all totally. Verily, in this are indeed signs for every steadfast, grateful (person).

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: But they said: Our Lord! Make the stage between our journeys longer. And they wronged themselves, therefore We made them bywords (in the land) and scattered them abroad, a total scattering. Lo! herein verily are portents for each steadfast, grateful (heart).

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: But they said, ‘Our Lord! Make the stages between our journeys far apart,’ and they wronged themselves. So We turned them into folktales and caused them to disintegrate totally. There are indeed signs in that for every patient and grateful [servant].

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: But they said: 'Lord, make the stages between our journeys longer' so they wronged themselves; so We made them news and We tore them utterly into pieces. Surely, there are signs in this for every one who is patient, thankful.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: But [insolently] they said, "Our Lord, lengthen the distance between our journeys," and wronged themselves, so We made them narrations and dispersed them in total dispersion. Indeed in that are signs for everyone patient and grateful.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They said, "Lord, make the distances of our journeys longer." They did injustice to themselves and We turned their existence into ancient tales by making them disintegrate totally. In this there is evidence (of the truth) for every forbearing and grateful person.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And they said: O our Lord! make spaces to be longer between our journeys; and they were unjust to themselves so We made them stories and scattered them with an utter scattering; most surely there are signs in this for every patient, grateful one

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Faqaloo rabbana baAAid bayna asfarina wathalamoo anfusahum fajaAAalnahum ahadeetha wamazzaqnahum kulla mumazzaqin inna fee thalika laayatin likulli sabbarin shakoorin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: but they said, "Our Lord! Make the stages of our journeys longer." Thus they wronged themselves and We made them bygone tales and scattered them throughout the land. There are certainly signs in that for everyone who is steadfast and thankful.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: But they said: "Our Lord! Place longer distances between our journey-stages": but they wronged themselves (therein). At length We made them as a tale (that is told), and We dispersed them all in scattered fragments. Verily in this are Signs for every (soul that is) patiently constant and grateful.

verses.text: وَ لَقَدْ صَدَّقَ‌ عَلَيْهِمْ‌ إِبْلِيسُ‌ ظَنَّهُ‌ فَاتَّبَعُوهُ‌ إِلاَّ فَرِيقاً مِنَ‌ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و همانا ابلیس، پندارش را [که گفته بود: نسل آدم را گمراه می کنم] درباره آنان تحقق یافت که همه جز گروهی از مؤمنان از او پیروی کردند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: شيطان گمان خود را در باره آنها درست يافت. و جز گروهى از مؤمنان، ديگران از او پيروى كردند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و همانا شيطان گمان خود را در مورد آنها راست يافت، و جز گروهى از مؤمنان، همه از او پيروى كردند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و قطعاً شيطان گمان خود را در مورد آنها راست يافت. و جز گروهى از مؤمنان، [بقيه‌] از او پيروى كردند!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و شیطان گمان باطل خود را درباره مردم، سخت به صدق و حقیقت رساند، پس جز فرقه کمی از اهل ایمان همه پیرو او شدند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: واقعاً ابلیس پندار خود را درباره‌ی آنان راست گرداند (و به کرسی نشاند). چرا که همگی از او پیروی کردند مگر گروه اندکی از مؤمنان. [[«لَقَدْ صَدَّقَ عَلَیْهِمْ إِبْلِیسُ ظَنَّهُ»: ابلیس گمان و آرزوی خود را درباره ایشان واقعیّت بخشید. شیطان پنداری که درباره آنان داشت، محقّق یافت. «عَلَیْهِمْ»: واژه (عَلی) به معنی (فی) است. «ظَنَّهُ»: اشاره به آرزو و قصد ابلیس در حق انسانها، به هنگام طرد شیطان از آستانه یزدان است (نگا: اعراف / 11 - 18، حجر / 38 - 44).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و به راستی شیطان ظن خود را درباره ایشان راست یافت، آنگاه [همگی‌] جز گروهی از مؤمنان از او پیروی کردند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (آری) بیقین، ابلیس گمان خود را درباره آنها محقّق یافت که همگی از او پیروی کردند جز گروه اندکی از مؤمنان!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و همانا راست آورد بر ایشان ابلیس پندار خویش را پس پیرویش کردند مگر گروهی از مؤمنان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و هر آينه ابليس گمان خود را در باره آنان- مردم سبا يا همه مردم- راست داشت پس او را پيروى كردند مگر گروهى اندك از مؤمنان.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و بی‌گمان شیطان گمان خود را در مورد آنان بی‌امان راست آورد . پس جز گروهی از مؤمنان، (دیگران) از او پیروی کردند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Thus Iblis found his supposition about them to be true; and except for a section of believers they follow him.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And indeed Iblis made his assumptions regarding them seem true, so they all followed him except the group of Muslims.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Iblis proved true his opinion of them, and they followed him, except a party of the believers.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And assuredly Iblis found his conjecture true concerning them; and they followed him all save a party of the believers.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And indeed Iblis (Satan) did prove true his thought about them, and they followed him, all except a group of true believers (in the Oneness of Allah).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Satan was correct in his assessment of them. They followed him, except for a group of believers.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Iblis found his estimate of them to be true, and they followed him, except a party of the believers.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And indeed Iblis did prove true his thought about them, and they followed him, all except a group of true believers.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And Satan indeed found his calculation true concerning them, for they follow him, all save a group of true believers.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Certainly Iblis had his conjecture come true about them. So they followed him—all except a part of the faithful.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: iblis' made his guess true to them; and all except for a party of believers followed him.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And Iblees had already confirmed through them his assumption, so they followed him, except for a party of believers.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Iblis (satan) made his judgment about them to come true. They all followed them except a believing group among them.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And certainly the Shaitan found true his conjecture concerning them, so they follow him, except a party of the believers.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Walaqad saddaqa AAalayhim ibleesu thannahu faittabaAAoohu illa fareeqan mina almumineena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Satan was correct in his assessment of them and they all followed him, except for a band of true believers,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And on them did Satan prove true his idea, and they followed him, all but a party that believed.

verses.text: وَ مَا کَانَ‌ لَهُ‌ عَلَيْهِمْ‌ مِنْ‌ سُلْطَانٍ‌ إِلاَّ لِنَعْلَمَ‌ مَنْ‌ يُؤْمِنُ‌ بِالْآخِرَةِ مِمَّنْ‌ هُوَ مِنْهَا فِي‌ شَکٍ‌ وَ رَبُّکَ‌ عَلَى‌ کُلِ‌ شَيْ‌ءٍ حَفِيظٌ

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و ابلیس را بر آنان [در اینکه فرمان بردارشان کند] هیچ تسلطی نبود [جز وسوسه کردن و باز بودن راه وسوسه بر او، هیچ سببی نداشت] مگر اینکه می خواستیم کسانی را که به آخرت ایمان دارند از آنان که درباره آن در تردیدند مشخص کنیم؛ و پروردگارت بر هر چیزی نگهبان است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و شيطان را بر آنان تسلطى نبود، مگر آنكه مى‌خواستيم معلوم داريم كه چه كسانى به قيامت ايمان دارند و چه كسانى از آن در شك هستند. و پروردگار تو نگهبان هر چيزى است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و را بر آنها تسلّطى نبود، جز آن كه [مى‌خواستيم‌] كسى را كه به آخرت ايمان دارد از كسى كه در باره‌ى آن مردّد است باز شناسيم، و پروردگار تو بر هر چيزى نگاهبان است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و [شيطان‌] را بر آنان تسلطى نبود، جز آنكه كسى را كه به آخرت ايمان دارد از كسى كه در باره آن در ترديد است باز شناسيم. و پروردگار تو بر هر چيزى نگاهبان است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: در صورتی که شیطان بر مردمان تسلطی نداشت (بلکه از حرص دنیا پیرو او شدند. و شیطان را بر این نداشتیم) مگر برای آنکه (به امتحان) آن کس را که به عالم قیامت ایمان آورد از آن کس که شک دارد معلوم گردانیم. و خدای تو بر هر چیز نگهبان و آگاه است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: شیطان هیچ گونه قدرتی بر آنان نداشت (تا با آن بتواند ایشان را به پیروی از خود وادارد. تنها کاری که از دست او ساخته است، وسوسه است. این هم بدو داده نشده است) مگر بدان خاطر تا بدانیم که چه کسی به آخرت ایمان می‌آورد، و چه کسی درباره‌ی آن متردّد می‌ماند. پروردگار تو مراقب (احوال) و نگهدار (حساب افعال بندگان) است. [[«سُلْطَانٍ»: سلطه و قدرت و استیلاء. «لِنَعْلَمَ»: (نگا: بقره / 143، آل‌عمران / 140 و 142 و 167، مائده / 94، کهف / 12). «حَفِیظٌ»: (نگا: هود / 57).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و او [شیطان‌] را بر آنان سلطه‌ای نبود، مگر آنکه سرانجام کسی را که به آخرت ایمان دارد، از کسی که از آن شک دارد، باز شناسانیم، و پروردگارت بر همه چیز نگهبان است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: او سلطه بر آنان نداشت جز برای اینکه مؤمنان به آخرت را از آنها که در شکّ هستند باز شناسیم؛ و پروردگار تو، نگاهبان همه چیز است!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و نیستش بر ایشان فرمانروائیی مگر تا بشناسیم آن را که ایمان آورد به آخرت از آنکه او است در شکی از آن و پروردگار تو است بر همه چیز نگهبان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و او را بر آنان هيچ چيرگى و دستى نبود جز براى آنكه [مى‌خواستيم‌] كسانى را كه به سراى واپسين ايمان دارند از كسانى كه از آن به شك اندرند باز شناسيم، و پروردگار تو بر هر چيزى نگاهبان است.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و شیطان را بر آنان هیچ‌گونه تسلّطی نبود، جز آنکه کسی را که به آخرت ایمان دارد، از کسی که درباره‌ی آن در تردید است نشانه گذاریم. و پروردگار تو بر هر چیزی بسی نگاهبان است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: He had no authority over them save for the purpose of Our knowing who believed in the world to come, and who doubted it. For your Lord keeps a watch over everything.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And Satan had no control over them at all, except that We willed to reveal as to who believes in the Hereafter and who is in doubt of it; and your Lord is a Guardian over all things.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Yet he had no authority over them, but that We might know him who believed in the Hereafter from him who was in doubt thereof Thy Lord is Guardian over everything.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And he hath no authority over them except that We would know him who believeth in the Hereafter from him who is in doubt thereof. And thy Lord is over everything a Warden.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And he (Iblis Satan) had no authority over them, except that We might test him, who believes in the Hereafter from him who is in doubt about it. And your Lord is a Hafiz over everything. (AllKnower of everything i.e. He keeps record of each and every person as regards deeds, and then He will reward them accordingly).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He had no authority over them; except that We willed to distinguish him who believes in the Hereafter, from him who is doubtful about it. Your Lord is Guardian over all things.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Iblis had no authority over them and whatever happened was in order that We might know him who believes in the Hereafter as distinct from him who is in doubt about it. Your Lord is watchful over everything.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And he had no authority over them, -- except that We might test him who believes in the Hereafter, from him who is in doubt about it. And your Lord is Watchful over everything.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And he had no warrant whatsoever against them, save that We would know him who believeth in the Hereafter from him who is in doubt thereof; and thy Lord (O Muhammad) taketh note of all things.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: He had no authority over them, but that We may ascertain those who believe in the Hereafter from those who are in doubt about it, and your Lord is watchful over all things.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Yet he had no authority over them except that We would know who believed in the Everlasting Life, from he who doubted. Your Lord is the Watcher over all things.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And he had over them no authority except [it was decreed] that We might make evident who believes in the Hereafter from who is thereof in doubt. And your Lord, over all things, is Guardian.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: He did not have any authority over them except to the extent that would allow Us to know who had faith in the life to come and who had doubts about it. Your Lord is a Guard over all things.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And he has no authority over them, but that We may distinguish him who believes in the hereafter from him who is in doubt concerning it; and your Lord is the Preserver of all things

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wama kana lahu AAalayhim min sultanin illa linaAAlama man yuminu bialakhirati mimman huwa minha fee shakkin warabbuka AAala kulli shayin hafeethun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: but he had no authority over them; We only desired to distinguish those who believed in the Hereafter from those who were in doubt concerning it. Your Lord is watchful over all things.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: But he had no authority over them,- except that We might test the man who believes in the Hereafter from him who is in doubt concerning it: and thy Lord doth watch over all things.

verses.text: قُلِ‌ ادْعُوا الَّذِينَ‌ زَعَمْتُمْ‌ مِنْ‌ دُونِ‌ اللَّهِ‌ لاَ يَمْلِکُونَ‌ مِثْقَالَ‌ ذَرَّةٍ فِي‌ السَّمَاوَاتِ‌ وَ لاَ فِي‌ الْأَرْضِ‌ وَ مَا لَهُمْ‌ فِيهِمَا مِنْ‌ شِرْکٍ‌ وَ مَا لَهُ‌ مِنْهُمْ‌ مِنْ‌ ظَهِيرٍ

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بگو: کسانی را که به جای خدا [سزاوار پرستیدن] پنداشته اید، بخوانید [تا خواسته هایتان را اجابت کنند، ولی آنها هیچ خواسته ای را از شما اجابت نمی کنند؛ زیرا] در آسمان ها و زمین، هموزن ذره ای را مالک نیستند و آنها را در آن دو هیچ سهم و شرکتی نیست، و از میان آنها هیچ پشتیبانی برای خدا وجود ندارد.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: بگو: بخوانيد كسانى را كه جز خداى يكتا خدا مى‌پنداريد. مالك ذره‌اى در آسمانها و زمين نيستند و در آفرينش آن دو شركتى نداشته‌اند و خدا را از ميان آنها ياريگرى نبوده است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بگو: كسانى را كه به جاى خدا پنداشته‌ايد بخوانيد آنها به اندازه‌ى ذرّه‌اى را نه در آسمان‌ها و نه در زمين مالك نيستند، و در آن دو هيچ شركتى ندارند، و از آنها كسى مددكار خدا نيست

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
